THE CALLER REPORTED AN ESTIMATE 50 000 LITERS OF SEWAGE OVERFLOW INTO THE ST. CROIX RIVER SINCE 2018/01/04. HE SAID THE OVERFLOW WAS DISCOVERED AROUND 8H00, HOWEVER HE BELIEVES IT HAD STARTED EARLIER. HE EXPLAINED THAT THE OVERFLOW WAS CAUSED BY A FROZEN UNDERGROUND PIPE THAT BROUGHT THE SEWAGE FROM THE PRIMARY PART OF TREATMENT PLANT TO THE SECONDARY CLARIFIER. IT TOOK 2 DAYS TO DISCOVER WHAT WAS HOLDING THE FLOWS. THE LIFT STATION WAS PUT OUT OF SERVICE AND THE CALLER BROUGHT A TRUCK TO SPILL HOT WATER ON THE PIPE TO UNFREEZE THE PIPE. THE CALLER ADDED THAT EVERYTHING IS REPAIRED AND BACK TO NORMAL SINCE 15H00 ON 2018/01/08. IB. EED-ACT AT 16H57 ON 2018/01/08. IB.

AT 0210EST, A FREIGHT TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY STOP AND DISCOVERED THE 95TH HEAD-CAR ON THE GROUND. THE ENGINEER OBSERVED A PLUME AND IMMEDIATELY PROCEEDED INTO THE OTHER DIRECTION (ALSO REPORTED A "BAD TASTE IN HIS MOUTH", WILL BE TRANSPORTED FOR EVALUATION ). SOME OF THE CARS ARE LOADED WITH XYLENE, NOS AND TWO PROPANE CARS. IT IS UNDETERMINED IF THE "PLUME" IS RELATED TO AN ACTUAL HAZARDOUS RELEASE OR SIMPLY DUST FROM IMPACT. THE AMOUNT OF CARS DERAILED ARE UNKNOWN; POSSIBLY 5+. DAMAGES WILL EXCEED THE $150K THRESHOLD.  A 1,000FT PERIMETER HAS BEEN SET IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY. NO EVACUATIONS OR OFF-SITE IMPACT REPORTED/CONFIRMED.
INCIDENT_LOCATION: * SEE MILE POST & SUB (NO ADDITIONAL DETAILS WERE PROVIDED)

NOAA/NESDIS POLLUTION REPORT:

REMARKS: POSSIBLE OIL WAS OBSERVED IN SATELLITE IMAGERY. THIS ANOMALY IS UNCONFIRMED AS OIL. THE SLICK WAS BELIEVED TO BE EMANATING FROM THE DESTROYED TAYLOR PLATFORM LOCATION AND WAS ORIENTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH WINDS TO THE NNE AT THE TIME OF THE IMAGE. THE ANOMALY WAS DISTINGUISHABLE FROM ITS HOMOGENEOUS SURROUNDINGS AND CONTAINED A SHIMMERY AREA THAT WAS BELIEVED TO BE RELATIVELY THICKER OIL COMPARED TO THE DARKER SLICK PORTION OF THE SLICK SURROUNDING IT. THE N-S FEATHERING SIGNATURE ALSO SUPPORTED THE ANOMALY'S IDENTIFICATION AS BEING OIL.

UNCERTAINTIES: A MORE PRECISE AREAL MEASURE OF THE ANOMALY COULD NOT BE ATTAINED DUE TO THE FEATHERING AND DARK OCEAN BACKGROUND, BUT IT IS POSSIBLE THE AREA WAS LARGER THAN THAT CALCULATED IN THIS REPORT.

ORIGINAL REPORT:
CALLER STATED THAT A CONTRACTOR HIT A PIPELINE WITH A DIRECTIONAL BORING UNIT.  THIS CAUSED GAS TO LEAK UNDER GROUND.  THE GAS FOLLOWED A PATH UNDERNEATH CONCRETE TO A BUILDING.  THE PIPELINE WAS "SQUEEZED OFF" HOWEVER A SPARK WITHIN THE BUILDING CAUSED THE GAS TO IGNITE AND START A FIRE.  RESIDUAL GAS UNDER THE CONCRETE FED THE FIRE.

UPDATED INFO:
THE TOTAL GAS LOSS HAS BEEN DETERMINED AS 22,895 CUBIC FEET.  CALLER STATES THE PIPELINE WAS HIT AT 1108 BUT IT ACTUALLY BECAME AN INCIDENT AT 1345.  CALLER ALSO STATES A PIZZA SHOP WAS EVACUATED (UNKNOWN NUMBER OF PEOPLE).  DAMAGE AMOUNT IS OVER $50,000.
